intro: Leachiella felina, commonly known as the cat's tail plant, is a species of flowering plant native to the Canary Islands. It belongs to the family Amaranthaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, cat-like tail-shaped inflorescence. The plant features small, clustered flowers that are typically greenish-yellow in color. It thrives in sunny, well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or coastal areas. Due to its unique appearance and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and specialized species.
